alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 3:20AM AKST until December 19 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing drizzle occuring this morning. Heavy snow expected this afternoon. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are expected. A glaze of ice accumulation is expected through 9 AM this morning. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 3 PM today to 6 AM Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing drizzle has moved into the Middle Tanana Valley this morning and will produce difficult travel conditions. Up to a glaze of accumultion is expected through 9 AM this morning. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
